  • Rating 7: New York City teenager Miles Morales struggles to live up to the expectations of his father, police officer Jefferson Davis, who sees Spider-Man as a menace.
  • Rating 8: Miles adjusts to prep school, and visits his uncle Aaron Davis, who takes him to an abandoned subway station to paint graffiti.
  • Rating 10: Miles is bitten by a radioactive spider and gains spider-like abilities similar to Spider-Man.
  • Rating 3: Returning to the station, Miles discovers a collider built by Wilson Fisk, who hopes to access parallel universes to bring back his late wife and son, whose deaths he blames on Spider-Man.
  • Rating 8: Miles watches as Spider-Man attempts to disable the collider while fighting Fisk's henchmen, Green Goblin and the Prowler.
  • Rating 4: Spider-Man saves Miles, but Green Goblin shoves Spider-Man into the collider, causing an explosion that kills Goblin and wounds Spider-Man.
  • Rating 8: Spider-Man gives Miles a USB flash drive designed to disable the collider, warning that the machine could destroy the city if reactivated.
  • Rating 3: After watching in horror as Fisk kills Spider-Man, Miles flees with Prowler in pursuit, eventually getting away from him.
  • Rating 3: As the city mourns Spider-Man's death, Miles tries to honor his legacy and become the new Spider-Man.
  • Rating 10: While trying out his newfound abilities, he inadvertently damages the drive.
  • Rating 3: At Spider-Man's grave, Miles meets Peter B. Parker, an older and worn-down version of Spider-Man from another dimension.
  • Rating 8: Upon meeting him, Miles discovers his ability to emit bio-electric bursts called "venom-blasts".
  • Rating 7: Peter reluctantly agrees to train Miles in exchange for help stealing data to create a new drive.
  • Rating 8: They infiltrate Fisk's research facility, and Miles discovers he has the power to turn invisible.
  • Rating 3: They are confronted by mad scientist Olivia Octavius, who discovers that Peter will die from cellular decay if he remains in their dimension.
  • Rating 10: Chased through the laboratory and surrounding forest by Octavius, Miles and Peter are saved by Gwen Stacy, a Spider-Woman from another dimension.
  • Rating 3: They then visit the deceased Spider-Man's aunt, May Parker, who is sheltering more Spider-people from other dimensions—Spider-Man Noir, Peni Parker, and Spider-Ham—who are also deteriorating.
  • Rating 10: Miles offers to disable the collider so the others can return home, but after questioning and testing him, they tell him that he lacks experience.
  • Rating 8: Distraught, Miles retreats to Aaron's home, where he discovers Aaron is the Prowler.
  • Rating 8: Miles returns to May's house, where Peni has completed the new drive; he is followed by Fisk, Prowler, Octavius, Scorpion, and Tombstone.
  • Rating 3: In the ensuing brawl, Miles reveals his identity to Aaron just as Aaron corners him.
  • Rating 8: Unwilling to kill his own nephew, Aaron spares Miles, but is fatally shot by Fisk.
  • Rating 3: Miles flees with Aaron, who tells him to keep going before dying.
  • Rating 3: Jefferson arrives on the scene and Miles escapes, leading Jefferson to mistake Spider-Man as Aaron's murderer.
  • Rating 6: The heroes regroup with a devastated Miles at his dorm room.
  • Rating 8: Peter restrains Miles to ensure his safety and leaves with the others, choosing to sacrifice himself by staying behind and deactivating the collider.
  • Rating 10: Jefferson arrives outside Miles' door and, assuming Miles does not want to speak to him, apologizes for his mistakes and inspires Miles.
  • Rating 10: Miles then manages to control his powers, escapes his restraints, and creates his own Spider-Man suit with May's help.
  • Rating 10: He joins the heroes, defeating Fisk's enforcers and using the new drive to send them home.
  • Rating 10: Fisk fights Miles, attracting the attention of Jefferson, who realizes that Spider-Man isn't the menace he saw him as.
  • Rating 10: Jefferson encourages Miles, who subdues Fisk with his venom-blast and throws him at the kill switch, causing the collider to explode and saving the city.
  • Rating 10: Fisk and his henchmen are arrested for their crimes and Jefferson recognizes the new Spider-Man as a hero while receiving evidence of Fisk's murders of Peter and Aaron.
  • Rating 10: Miles embraces the responsibilities of his new life, while the heroes return to their lives in their own dimensions.
  • Rating 6: Later, Gwen finds a way to contact Miles from her own dimension.
  • Rating 3: In another dimension, Miguel O'Hara, also known as Spider-Man 2099, travels to Earth-67 and argues with its Spider-Man.
